name: Footsteps On Dirt (Retro Style)
description:
You must credit me if you use this! Just write "Footsteps On Dirt (Retro Style)" by SilverIllusionist somewhere in your projects credits. I'd appreciate if you sent me a link to the finished project when it's done, I love seeing how people use my work!

While working on one of my horror samples, I was fascinated to discover that filtering a sound through a vocoder and frequency shifter made it sound like a footsteps on dirt or gravel. Its thin timbre makes it seem like something you'd hear on a system with an old sound card, hence the "Retro Style" label. 

Produced with Ableton.

name: FEETHmn_Footsteps On The Icy Sidewalk In The Yard 1_EM
description: A sound recording of my footsteps on the long icy sidewalk in the courtyard, in the evening. The recently fallen snow melted and almost immediately turned into ice. Recorded May 04 , 2024 on Tascam DR-05x, with post processing. Location: Ekaterinburg City (Russia) I ask you, if possible, to help this wonderful site (not me) stay afloat and develop further. Make a donation https://freesound.org/donations/donate/ if my sounds helped or liked you. Freesound remains free of advertising, let's appreciate it together. Enjoy it! I hope that my sounds and phonograms will be useful in your creativity. Feel free to leave your comments with ratings, even if they are critical. Note: audio quality is always better when downloaded. As for attribution, you should credit me in your work. How to do this, see here . This sound CANNOT be used in stock (royalty free) materials. Do not post, publish or redistribute my RAW sounds/files on YouTube or any other sites, platforms or services. My sounds can be used within your projects (including commercial ones, if the license assigned to this sound allows it), as part of an artistic form or design. Otherwise, please adhere to the license rules, which can be found here . I would be glad if you post a link to your finished product on Freesound.org, or a video review of it (in the comments to one or more of my sounds) with a short text stating that this sound was used in this project. This will be a kind of small gratitude for my work. And, of course, it's always interesting to see the live context in which my sounds are used. Thank you.

name: FEETHmn_Footsteps Upstairs.Wooden House.With Ceiling Creaking.Designed 2_EM
description: Footsteps on the floor above creak of floorboards and ceiling in a wooden house. These are the design steps. name: FEETHmn_Footsteps Upstairs.Wooden House.With Ceiling Creaking.Echoes From Stairs.Designed 2_EM
description: Footsteps on the floor above creak of floorboards and ceiling in a wooden house. These are the designed steps. In this sound design, among other things, I used the standard Fruity Stereo Shaper plugin to simulate the movement of steps. To set the motion, not only the faders of the Left and Right channels were used, but also the phase shift control between the stereo channels. This made it possible to give a naturalness closer to the one that we perceive with our ears, listening to the movement of objects in the real world. At the same time, it felt like the sound was really coming from somewhere above (when listening with headphones). There are practically no phase artifacts when listening to mono in this case. name: MALFOY_Florian_2015_2016_Footsteps.wav
description:
I decided to create four sounds around the theme of a thief coming in a place shooting someone/something and running away after the alarm had rung. This sound of footsteps is used for the coming of the thief in the place. Walking slowly, this woman shows she is confident about what she is going to do. For this, I used a recorded sound of someone walking. I put a noise reduction first to just keep the main sound. Next I played on the « enveloppe » to adjust the sound and change the speed (Speed Multiplier 0,900) to give to the thief a calm way of walking.

Typologie de Schaeffer Itération complexe (X'')

Morphologie :
Masse : Groupe nodal
Timbre Harmonique : Pauvre
Grain : Rugueux
Allure : Absence de Vibrato
Dynamique : Abrupte
Profil mélodique : Variation Scalaire
Profil de Masse: Bruit de pas à placer dans un fond sonore.

name: KOUDSI_Linda_2015_2016_footsteps.aiff
description:
*Your spaceship crashed for a mysterious reason on an unknown and hostile planet. You are on your own, the other people who where with you disapeared. You have no other choice but to start to look for them. A long and exhausting walk awaits you…*

For this sound, I recorded the noize of footsteps on gravel. Then I applied some effects (Wahwah, Fade Out, Vocoder and 	a frequency shifter effect) by using Audacity. 

Description du son :

V : Continu varié / X : continu complexe

1) Masse: groupe nodal c’est-à-dire plusieurs sons complexes.
2) Timbre harmonique: éclatant
3) Grain: les bruits de pas forment un son rugueux, tandis que le son que l’on entend au tout début (puis clairement à la fin) donne un son lisse. Le son parait donc plus rugueux que lisse. 
4) Allure: léger vibrato 
5) Dynamique: l’attaque du son est brute car elle commence directement avec une note aiguë. Le son change graduellement (violent au milieu et plus doux à la fin grâce au fondu). 
6) Profil mélodique: Le son formé par les bruits de pas fait une variation scalaire tandis que le son synthétisé une variation serpentine, il n’y a pas de séparation nette entre les hauteurs. 
7) Profil de masse: calibre.

name: Footsteps On A Stony Beach
description:
You can hear footsteps followed by a small wave. 

Recorded on the beach near the viewing platform, Marine Parade, Napier, New Zealand. This is a beach covered in small rocks.

Recorded on Thursday 13 October 2016 on a calm, sunny day at around 2pm. There was little wind and the sea was very calm - only tiny waves crashing against the beach. 
Recorded with a Zoom H4n.

name: Japan_Ina_Farmhouse_Footsteps_TAKE_1_Wooden_Planks_Tatami_Mats_24bit_96KHz.wav
description: Recorded in Japan, Nagano, Ina, in a traditional Japanese farmhouse in the Japanese alps. Randomly walking around on tatami and wooden floors. An experiment recording footsteps in stereo (Zoom H2n recorder), hanging the recorder just above my feet. It's not perfect (too much background noise, sometimes some handling noises), but with the right editing I think you can get some cool samples out of this. Check out the other take as well.

name: the walking cashews.wav (simuated footsteps)
description:
An attempt to make suspenseful footstep sounds by playing a can of cashews with a plastic lid like a drum. The key is to get some shuffling sounds from the nuts, but not enough to be louder than the impact. I think...

I tried to get a good range of speeds and tones. I think I did an okay job at simulating someone jogging up or down stairs.

Seems good enough for a radio drama, at least.

description:
A quiet spring morning with birds singing. When bells started to ring, I'm moved to go closer : sound of footsteps on gravels, on a little bridge over a river.
Recorded by myself with ZOOM H4

My sounds are listed "licenced under the Creative Commons Attribution Non-Commercial" because I loathe finding my sounds sold as mobile phone rings or used by advertising executives BUT for all ARTISTIC PROJECTS you're welcome, just ask me !

name: foley footsteps - raw.wav
description: Footsteps on gravel. Two versions: one with some plugin processing and one just raw (this is the raw one). There is "room tone" at the end too. That way if you want to do your own audio engineering besides what i did, you can. Please share with me how you may have improved these sounds… removed noise, brought out the sweet, etc. Created at a secret spot on the Cali central coast in Aug 2014. Used a RODE shotgun mic, a little background via the default Zoom H6 mic, and post was done in ProTools/Waves.

name: Foley Footsteps - with processing.wav
description:
Footsteps on gravel. Two versions: one with some plugin processing and one just raw (this is the processed one). There is "room tone" at the end too (albeit, processed). License requirement for credit is waived if the project doesn't have anywhere reasonable to credit. But, you know, pay it forward.
Created at a secret spot on the Cali central coast in Aug 2014. Used a RODE shotgun mic, a little background via the default Zoom H6 mic, and post was done in ProTools/Waves.

name: 148795__mentalsanityoff__footsteps-solid-wood-female-barefoot-running HUM Removed.wav
description: Using the Remove Hum tool on Izotope RX2, I took out filtered out the hum that occurs in the 190-220 Hz range. I believe any EQ could filter that hum out at that range without affecting the bass in the footsteps.  I believe the footsteps are in the 50-60 Hz range anyway.

name: DELCLAUD_Antoine_2020_2021_footsteps_rock.wav
description:
I have recorded footsteps in forests always with the aim of using them for sound fiction.
To this I added 2 very progressive fades at the end as well as at the beginning of the recording in order to create a pyramidal sound wave and to create the impression of coming together and then moving away from the microphone.

name: Creaking Chair straining under stress crack footsteps walking rocking back and forth.wav

Recorded with a pair of DIY stereo electret mics on zoom F4 recorder at 24 bit/48Khz. There has been some noise reduction and EQing applied.
